questiontext.text:
Exercise

In some questions below it will be necessary to apply integration by parts more than once.

Find

  1. \({\displaystyle\int t e^{-st}\mathrm{d}t}\) where \(s\) is a constant,[[input:ans11]] [[validation:ans11]] [[feedback:prt11]]
  2. \({\displaystyle\int t^2 e^{-st}\mathrm{d}t}\) where \(s\) is a constant.[[input:ans12]] [[validation:ans12]] [[feedback:prt12]]

Oppgave

Regn ut

  1. \({\displaystyle\int t e^{-st}\mathrm{d}t}\) hvor \(s\) er en konsant.[[input:ans11]] [[validation:ans11]] [[feedback:prt11]]
  2. \({\displaystyle\int t^2 e^{-st}\mathrm{d}t}\) hvor \(s\) er en konsant.[[input:ans12]] [[validation:ans12]] [[feedback:prt12]]

generalfeedback.text:
We apply integraton by parts: \[ \int u{{\rm d}v\over {\rm d}x}{\rm d}x=uv- \int{{\rm d}u\over {\rm d}x}v\,{\rm d}x\]

or alternatively: \[\int f(x)g(x)\,{\rm d}x=f(x)\,\int g(x){\rm d}x -\int {{\rm d}f\over {\rm d}x}\left\{\int g(x){\rm d}x\right\}{\rm d}x.\]

  1. We are given the integral \({\displaystyle\int {@exp11@} \mathrm{d}t}.\)

    We have \( f(x) = {@f11@}\) and \(g(x) = {@g11@}.\)

    Hence:

    \(\begin{align} \int {@exp11@} \mathrm{d}t &={@f11@} \int {@g11@} \mathrm{d}t-\int \left({@df11@} \cdot \int {@g11@}\mathrm{d}t \right)\mathrm{d}t \\ &= {@f11* intg11@}- \int {@df11*intg11@}\mathrm{d}t \\ &= {@ta11@}. \end{align}\)

  2. We are given the integral \({\displaystyle\int {@exp12@} \mathrm{d}t}.\)

    We have \( f(x) = {@f12@}\) and \(g(x) = {@g12@}.\)

    Hence:

    \(\begin{align} \int {@exp12@} \mathrm{d}t &={@f12@} \int {@g12@} \mathrm{d}t-\int \left({@df12@} \cdot \int {@g12@}\mathrm{d}t \right)\mathrm{d}t \\ &= {@f12* intg12@}- \int {@df12*intg12@}\mathrm{d}t. \end{align}\)

    We now need to find \(\displaystyle \int {@df12*intg12@} \mathrm{d}t \) using intefration by parts again. We get:

    \(\displaystyle {\int {@df12*intg12@} \mathrm{d}t= {@int(df12*intg12,t)@}}.\)

    Altogether we have:

    \(\displaystyle{\int {@exp12@} \mathrm{d}t= {@ta12@}}.\)

Vi bruker delvis integrasjon: \[ \int u{{\rm d}v\over {\rm d}x}{\rm d}x=uv- \int{{\rm d}u\over {\rm d}x}v\,{\rm d}x\]

alternativt: \[\int f(x)g(x)\,{\rm d}x=f(x)\,\int g(x){\rm d}x -\int {{\rm d}f\over {\rm d}x}\left\{\int g(x){\rm d}x\right\}{\rm d}x.\]

  1. Gitt integralet \({\displaystyle\int {@exp11@} \mathrm{d}t}.\)

    Velger \( f(x) = {@f11@}\) og \(g(x) = {@g11@}.\)

    Dermed:

    \(\begin{align} \int {@exp11@} \mathrm{d}t &={@f11@} \int {@g11@} \mathrm{d}t-\int \left({@df11@} \cdot \int {@g11@}\mathrm{d}t \right)\mathrm{d}t \\ &= {@f11* intg11@}- \int {@df11*intg11@}\mathrm{d}t \\ &= {@ta11@}. \end{align}\)

  2. Gitt integralet \({\displaystyle\int {@exp12@} \mathrm{d}t}.\)

    Velger \( f(x) = {@f12@}\) and \(g(x) = {@g12@}.\)

    Dermed:

    \(\begin{align} \int {@exp12@} \mathrm{d}t &={@f12@} \int {@g12@} \mathrm{d}t-\int \left({@df12@} \cdot \int {@g12@}\mathrm{d}t \right)\mathrm{d}t \\ &= {@f12* intg12@}- \int {@df12*intg12@}\mathrm{d}t. \end{align}\)

    Nå må vi finne \(\displaystyle \int {@df12*intg12@} \mathrm{d}t \) med en ny runde delvis integrasjon. Vi får at:

    \(\displaystyle {\int {@df12*intg12@} \mathrm{d}t= {@int(df12*intg12,t)@}}.\)

    Tilsammen får vi:

    \(\displaystyle{\int {@exp12@} \mathrm{d}t= {@ta12@}}.\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
